title: Storm Center Update - Saturday PM
text:
Storm Center Update - Saturday PM October 24, 2015, 3:39 PM by Grant Smith 
The few clouds we had this morning cleared out and KELOLAND was left with a clear blue sky Saturday afternoon. Temperatures rose to within a few of degrees of 60Â° which is near average, or just above average, for late October. 
Clear to mostly clear skies overnight tonight with calm winds and lows dropping to the 30s. 
Sunday morning will be mostly clear but clouds will drift over in the afternoon so afternoon skies will be partly to mostly cloudy. Afternoon temperatures still reaching the 50s to 60s. 
Chance for rain Monday afternoon through Tuesday for most of the area. If temperatures can get cold enough, fast enough, some snow is possible in the Black Hills with this next round of rain. Highs next week will start off in the 50s and slowly cool to the upper 40s by the end of week.
